channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JCR-1185] building trunk fails with javacc plugin version 2.2

item.summary: building trunk fails with javacc plugin version 2.2

comments.comment: I can't reproduce this. It seems like a problem in the JavaCC processing. Can you send us the full output of "mvn clean package"?

The following jjtree warnings seem relevant:

Can't create output file /Users/adc/dev/jackrabbit/jackrabbit-core/target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/lucene/fulltext/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/lucene/fulltext/QueryParser.jj
Can't create output file /Users/adc/dev/jackrabbit/jackrabbit-core/target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/sql/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/sql/JCRSQL.jj
Can't create output file /Users/adc/dev/jackrabbit/jackrabbit-core/target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/XPath.jj

Can you do "touch target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath/XPath.jj"?
target/generated-src/main/java/org/apache/jackrabbit/core/query/xpath is empty so the touch command fails.

AFAIK touch should create the file if it doesn't exist. Can you try creating a file in that directory in some other way? I suspect that there's something wrong in your environment that prevents jjtree from creating the *.jj files.
IIUC, the problem is that the intermediate directories do not exist.
I had the same problem when starting with an empty .m2 repository: apparently this error occurs with javacc plugin 2.2 only. Added an explicit version number 2.1.
For the record, this problem seems related to the http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MJAVACC-29 issue introduced in the javacc plugin version 2.2
Merged to the 1.3 branch in revision 609917.
